text: and vistas a chemical and fiber
manufacturing company being a very
global company we struggled a lot with
being able to compare and contrast our
various plant sites so we realized you
really needed to think about this more
globally and how do we unlock all of
that data that we had available to us
and so when we started having
conversations with AWS we found that
they were really focused on where we
wanted to go and how do we get there as
fast as we were looking to go and wanted
to move and innovate quickly with us so
for a manufacturing company I'd say the
first one that I was really impressed
with was snowball because we had so much
data sitting at the plant sites in order
to quickly move that into a landscape
that we could compare it or into an s3
environment that was huge for us
and then we use s3 for our data Lake and
glue to catalog the data so that's easy
to retrieve for both our data scientists
and data exploration analysts but also
for our redshift environment to be able
to grab that and then bring it into more
of a data warehouse environment and then
on top of that we do use alexa devices
and some of our plant sites as well and
we feed the data out through our
analytics environment into that alexa
device so that people in our warehouses
can communicate through voice versus
logging into an older system that you
know isn't as user friendly this has
really enabled us tenfold to what we
anticipated honestly and mainly that's
because we're getting more efficient at
our production process getting more
predictive in our sales visibility and
order visibility so that we can have
more proactive discussions with our with
our end customers
